com.fizzikgames.fizlib.pathfinding

Interface TileMap


  • public interface TileMap
    A tile map is a world that is stored in coordinates referred to as rows or columns, and can even have a depth of traversable layers.
    Version:
    1.00
    Author:
    Maxim Tiourin

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCost(Mover mover, Node srcNode, Node dstNode)
      Returns the cost of the move on the TileMap taking in consideration the cost of the mover.
      int getDepth()
      Returns the depth of the map (or how many z levels it has)
      Maps with only 2 dimensions should return 1;
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height (y or rows) of the TileMap
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width (x or columns) of the TileMap
      boolean isWalkableTile(Mover mover, Node srcNode, Node dstNode)
      Returns whether or not the destination node is a valid move on the TileMap taking in consideration mover.

    • Method Detail

      • isWalkableTile

        boolean isWalkableTile(Mover mover,
                     Node srcNode,
                     Node dstNode)
        Returns whether or not the destination node is a valid move on the TileMap taking in consideration mover.
        Parameters:
        mover - The mover object to consider for.
        srcNode - The starting node.
        dstNode - The destination node.
        Returns:
        boolean of whether or not the destination node is a valid move.

        srcNode - The starting node.
        dstNode - The destination node.
        Returns:
        cost

        Returns the depth of the map (or how many z levels it has)

        Returns:
